BundleModule.name: BundleModule
BundleModule.summary: Create a collection of NFTs that lets you optionally mint multiple copies of each NFT.

examples.python:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSdk, SdkOptions

# You can switch out this RPC url with any url you like

sdk = ThirdwebSdk(SdkOptions(), 'https://rpc-mumbai.maticvigil.com')
sdk.set_private_key(os.environ['PRIVATE_KEY'])
bundle_module = sdk.get_bundle_module("{{module_address}}")

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets NFT balance (number of a specific NFT in this module owned by the wallet).

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet to check NFT balance
address = "{{wallet_address}"

# The token ID of the NFT you want to check the wallets balance of
token_id = 0

print(bundle_module.balance_of(address, token_id))

methods.name: burn
methods.remarks: Burn an NFT, permanently taking it out of circulation and reducing the supply.

examples.python:
# The token ID of the NFT you want to burn
token= 0
# The number of specified NFTs you want to burn
burn_amount = 1
bundle_module.burn(MintBundleArg(token_id=token, amount=burn_amount))

methods.name: createAndMint
methods.remarks: Mint an NFT with a specified supply.

methods.name: createAndMintBatch
methods.remarks: Mint many different NFTs with specified supplies.

methods.name: getAll
methods.remarks: Get data associated with NFTs in this module.

examples.python:
# You can get every NFT in the module
nfts = bundle_module.get_all()
print(nfts)

# Or you can get optionally get the metadata of a specific NFT
token_id = 0
nfts = bundle_module.get(token_id)

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the connected wallet to another wallet.

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet you want to send the NFT to
toAddress = "0x..."

# The token ID of the NFT you want to send
tokenId = "0"

# The number of NFTs you want to send
amount = 1

bundle_module.transfer(toAddress, tokenId, amount)

methods.signature: transfer(to: string, tokenId: string, amount: BigNumberish): Promise<TransactionReceipt>;

methods.name: transferBatchFrom
methods.remarks: Transfer NFTs from the one wallet to another.
methods.signature: transferBatchFrom(from: string, to: string, args: INFTBundleBatchArgs[], data?: BytesLike): Promise<TransactionReceipt>;

BundleModule.signature: export declare class BundleModule extends ModuleWithRoles<NFTBundleContract> implements ITransferable

NFTModule.name: NFTModule
NFTModule.summary: Create a collection of one-of-one NFTs.

examples.python:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSdk, SdkOptions
# You can switch out this RPC url with any other RPC url if your choice

sdk = ThirdwebSdk(SdkOptions(), 'https://rpc-mumbai.maticvigil.com')
sdk.set_private_key(os.environ['PRIVATE_KEY'])
nft_module = sdk.get_nft_module("{{module_address}}")

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets NFT balance (number of NFTs in this module owned by the wallet).

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet to check NFT balance
address = {{wallet_address}}

balance = nft_module.balance_of(address)
print(balance)

methods.name: burn
methods.remarks: Burn an NFT, permanently taking it out of circulation and reducing the supply.

examples.python:
# The token ID of the NFT you want to burn
token_id = 0

nft_module.burn(token_id)

methods.name: getAll
methods.remarks: Get all the data associated with every NFT in this module.

examples.python:
nfts = nft_module.get_all()
print(nfts)

methods.name: getOwned
methods.remarks: Get all the data associated with the NFTs owned by a specific wallet.

methods.name: mintTo
methods.remarks: Mint an NFT to a specified wallet.

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the connected wallet to another wallet.

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet you want to send the NFT to
to_address = {{wallet_address}}

# The token ID of the NFT you want to send
token_id = 0

nft_module.transfer(to_address, token_id)

NFTModule.signature: export declare class NFTModule extends ModuleWithRoles<SignatureMint721> implements ITransferable, ISignatureMinter

PackModule.name: PackModule
PackModule.summary: Create lootboxes of NFTs with rarity based open mechanics.

examples.python:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSdk, SdkOptions

# You can switch out this RPC URL for your own.
sdk = ThirdwebSdk(SdkOptions(), 'https://rpc-mumbai.maticvigil.com')
sdk.set_private_key(os.environ['PRIVATE_KEY'])
pack_module = sdk.get_pack_module("{{module_address}}")

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets pack balance (number of a specific packs in this module owned by the wallet).

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet to check pack balance
address = {{wallet_address}}
# The token ID of the pack you want to check the wallets balance of
tokenId = 0

balance = pack_module.balanceOf(address, tokenId)
print(balance)

methods.name: create
methods.remarks: Create a new pack with its own rewards.

methods.name: getAll
methods.remarks: Get data associated with every pack in this module.

examples.python:
packs = pack_module.get_all()
print(packs)

methods.name: getNFTs
methods.remarks: Get data associated with the rewards inside a specified pack

examples.python:
# The pack ID of the pack whos rewards you want to get
packId = 0

nfts = pack_module.get_nfts(packId)
print(nfts)

methods.name: open
methods.remarks: Open a pack to burn it and obtain the reward asset inside.

examples.python:
# The pack ID of the asset you want to buy
packId = 0
rewards =pack_module.open(packId)
print(rewards)

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer a pack from the connected wallet to another wallet.

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet you want to send the pack to
toAddress = "0x..."

# The token ID of the pack you want to send
tokenId = "0"

# The number of packs you want to send
amount = 1

pack_module.transfer(toAddress, tokenId, amount);

methods.signature: transfer(to: string, tokenId: string, amount: BigNumber): Promise<void>;

PackModule.signature: export declare class PackModule extends ModuleWithRoles<PackContract> implements ITransferable

TokenModule.name: TokenModule
TokenModule.summary: Create a standard crypto token or crypto currency.

examples.python:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSdk, SdkOptions

# You can switch out this RPC URL for your own.
sdk = ThirdwebSdk(SdkOptions(), 'https://rpc-mumbai.maticvigil.com')
sdk.set_private_key(os.environ['PRIVATE_KEY'])
token_module = sdk.get_currency_module("{{module_address}}")

methods.name: allowanceOf
methods.remarks: Get the allowance of one wallet over another's funds - the allowance of a different address for a token is the amount of tokens that the wallet is allowed to spend on behalf of the connected wallet.

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet who owns the funds
address = "0x23302DA41ae4A69875321343D7ACA464a4E72DB2"

# Address of the wallet to check token allowance
otherAddress = "0x..."

allowance = token_module.allowance_of(address, otherAddress)
print(allowance)

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets token balance.

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet to check token balance
address = "0x23302DA41ae4A69875321343D7ACA464a4E72DB2"

balance = token_module.balanceOf(address)
print(balance)

methods.name: burn
methods.remarks: Burn tokens held by the connected wallet

examples.python:
# The amount of this token you want to burn
amount = 100

token_module.burn(amount)

methods.name: mintTo
methods.remarks: Mint tokens to a specified address

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet you want to mint the tokens to
toAddress = {{wallet_address}}

# The amount of this token you want to mint
amount = 1.5 * 10 ** 18

token_module.mint_to(toAddress, amount)

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer tokens from the connected wallet to another wallet.

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet you want to send the tokens to
toAddress = "0x..."

# The amount of tokens you want to send
amount = 0

token_module.transfer(toAddress, amount)

methods.name: transferFrom
methods.remarks: Transfer tokens from one wallet to another

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet sending the tokens
fromAddress = {{wallet_address}}
# Address of the wallet you want to send the tokens to
toAddress = "0x..."
# The number of tokens you want to send
amount = 100

# Note that the connected wallet must have approval to transfer the tokens of the fromAddress
token_module.transfer_from(fromAddress, toAddress, amount)

methods.signature: transferFrom(from: string, to: string, amount: BigNumberish): Promise<TransactionReceipt>;

TokenModule.signature: export declare class TokenModule extends ModuleWithRoles<Coin> implements ITransferable
